text: The nuclear factor of activated T cells ( NFAT ) group of transcription factors is retained in the cytoplasm of quiescent cells .
NFAT activation is mediated in part by induced nuclear import .
This process requires calcium - dependent dephosphorylation of NFAT caused by the phosphatase calcineurin .
The c-Jun amino-terminal kinase ( JNK ) phosphorylates <extra_id_0> NFAT4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on two sites .
Mutational removal of the JNK phosphorylation sites caused constitutive nuclear localization of <extra_id_0> NFAT4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: In contrast , JNK activation in calcineurin - stimulated cells caused nuclear exclusion of <extra_id_0> NFAT4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation caused <extra_id_0> Theme exclusion <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Localization exclusion <extra_id_0> Theme NFAT4 <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: These findings show that the nuclear accumulation of <extra_id_0> NFAT4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoted by calcineurin is opposed by the JNK signal transduction pathway .
